applications

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • applications.App

  • public final class App
extends java.lang.Object
    IN DEVELOPMENT. SUBJECT TO CHANGE. A dynamic and versatile class that can represent any Command and Telemetry App. Every App is an instance of this class with App-specific parameters. The parameters are configured from an XML document through the packets.housekeeping.XMLParser class. This is done through File -> Populate Apps and selecting appropriately-formatted XML files on your computer.
    Author:
    Joe Benassi

    • Constructor Detail

      • App

        public App(java.lang.String name,
   java.lang.String prefix,
   java.util.ArrayList<CmdPkt> commands,
   Telemetry[] telemetry,
   int appID)
        This is a Command and Telemetry app configured with app-specific parameters, and can represent any Command and Telemetry app. Every app is an instance of this class with app-specific parameters. The parameters are configured from an XML document through the packets.housekeeping.XMLParser class. This is done through File -> Populate Apps and selecting appropriately-formatted XML files on your computer.
        Parameters:
        displayName - The name that appears in the menu. Specific to an App.
        popupName - The name that appears in the popup telemetry page. Specific to an App.
        prefix - The prefix name specific to an App.
        commands - The command information specific to an App. This input ArrayList should contain every CmdPkt for this App, with each fully defined in all ways, including its parameters.
        telemetry - The telemetry information specific to an App. This input array should contain all of the telemetry qualities possible to display for the App. For example, if this were the Executive Services app, telemetry.length = 35.
        appID - The ID specific to an App.

    • Method Detail

      • getAppID

        public final int getAppID()
        Returns the ID of this particular App. Used to differentiate Apps behind-the-scenes.
        Returns:
        the ID of this particular App.

      • updateTelemetry

        public final void updateTelemetry(int index)
        Updates the GUI's displayed value of Telemetry[index]. Telemetry[index] contains the real-time correct value, and the GUI updates its current value to this when this method is executed.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the GUI to update to its correct, current value is defined in Telemetry[index].

      • updateTelemetry

        public final void updateTelemetry()
        Updates the GUI to display the current telemetry data. This occurs immediately, and will update each telemetry quality once.

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this particular App.
        Returns:
        The name of this particular App.

      • getCommandNames

        public final java.lang.String[] getCommandNames()
        Returns the names of the commands, as displayed in the Menu.
        Returns:
        the names of the commands, as displayed in the Menu.

      • getCommandListener

        public final org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Listener getCommandListener(int index)
        Returns a Listener for a Command that, when executed, launches the parameter-input window for that Command.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the desired Command within this App.
        Returns:
        A Listener for a Command that, when executed, launches the parameter-input window for that Command.

      • getTelemetryListener

        public final org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Listener getTelemetryListener(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
        Returns a Listener that, when executed, launches the popup telemetry window for this App. After it is launched, the input Shell is given focus.
        Parameters:
        shell - The shell containing the main Shell of the app.
        Returns:
        A Listener that launches the popup telemetry window when executed
